text: Taiwan hijack suspect detained by China police. TAIPEI 1997-03-10 A jobless journalist suspected of hijacking of a Taiwan civilian aircraft to China on Monday was detained by mainland authorities moments after the plane touched down at Xiamen, Taiwan authorities said. "_ He was taken away by mainland public security authorities, _"Lee Yun-ning, general manager of Far East Air Transport, whose Boeing 757 was involved in the incident, said in Taiwan. Lee said the plane was likely to return almost immediately. "_ We hope that the plane can fly back to Taiwan within one hour, _"Lee said at a news briefing. Lee said 150 passengers and six crew were still aboard the plane that was commandeered shortly after departing the southern Taiwan port city of Kaohsiung on a scheduled flight to Taipei. He said the plane was being refuelled at Xiamen in China's southeastern Fujian province for the return flight. "_ We already have had contact with Taiwan affairs officials in Beijing and have received authorisation for the plane to return to Taiwan, _"Lee said. "_ The matter now is in the hands of the local authorities in Xiamen. _"
title: TAIWAN : Taiwan hijack suspect detained by China police.
